name: Trees Around the Branch Tour at Steeles Library
description:
Did you know Steeles Library and its neighbourhood are home to a variety of trees? Join the knowledgeable City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff to explore the natural world on a local neighbourhood walk. Learn to recognize different species and fun facts about their cultural and ecological importance. Don't worry if you participated last year, this year features a new selection of trees!
Children under 12 must be accompanied by a parent/caregiver. The tour will start and end at the Steeles Library, Multipurpose Room, and will be guided by the City of Toronto Urban Forestry staff.

organizer.name: Urban Forestry, Natural Environment and Community Programs

name: Panamerican Food & Music Festival
description:
Join us for Canada’s largest festival celebrating the best food and culture of the Western Hemisphere – returning for its 13th year.

Named one of Ontario’s Top 100 Festivals and Events, and Canada’s Best Latin Festival, Panamfest presents colourful live music and dance performances, the Panamerican Parade, food demonstrations and competitions by international chefs, a youth talent showcase, and a Panamerican vendors’ market. It celebrates the excellence and diversity of the 41 countries of North, Central and South America and the Caribbean. Panamfest delivers food, flavour and fun – Panamerican style – for the entire family.

name: Come Together: Canada Music Festival
description: At Kids Rock For Kids we believe the impact of forging worldwide bonds among the next generation to be profound, and necessary in the pursuit of a global citizenry that strives toward a common, peaceful future. We can think of no better way to forge those bonds than through music.  The shared experience of using that music to help others heightens the strength of those bonds and reinforces the resolve in our young performers that they can make a difference. Because we seek out young musicians of truly exceptional talent, who are often already committed to careers in music, we expect that more than a few future stars will have grown up in our community — and that the philanthropic instinct we help to nurture now will benefit the world later.

name: Thursday Night Korean Jazz Dinner with Gonia
description: Seamlessly blending traditional Korean rhythms with sophisticated jazz elements, drawing attention both at home and internationally for their mastery. Gonia has created a new style of K-jazz based on traditional rhythms on the janggu, hourglass-shaped, double headed drum, with smooth and progressive guitar and bass licks with sophisticated melodies. Their music features different traditional rhythms - the breath of the gutgeori, the joy of jajinmori, and the dynamism that comes from whimori are all harmonized with improvisation and the beauty of jazz to create Gonia’s unique sound!
